newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan Hui Shung group buys 54,000T U.S. soy/corn.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan Hui Shung group buys 54,000T U.S. soy/corn.

text.p: Taiwan's Hui Shung Group late on Thursday bought a combined shipment of 38,000 tonnes of U.S. soybeans and 16,000 tonnes of U.S. No.2 corn, traders said.
The Hui Shung Group includes Hui Shung Agriculture and Food Corp, Eagle Food Industry and Charoen Pokphand.
Traders said the shipment is to be supplied by Kanematsu, marking the Japanese firm's first deal with Taiwan's grain and oilseeds buyers at open tender in many years.
The tender was delayed by haggling over freight prices, which had yet to be decided, traders said.
Details for the shipment are as follow:
